Method Detail

initializeFromFile

void initializeFromFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                        int fileNumber,
                        long blockOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
Initialize the index from a file. This may for in-memory structures be to read the content of the file into memory, or for disk based indexes to establish a point of refference in the underlying file.

The format file recieved of this method should be compatible with the data dumped by the dumpToFile methods.

Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index is stored.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

initializeFromFile

void initializeFromFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                        int fileNumber,
                        long blockOffset,
                        int byteOffset)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
Overload of the initializeFromFile method with byte offset into the first block of the file.

Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index is stored.
byteOffset - The number of bytes into the first block of the file the index starts.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

writeToFile

void writeToFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                 int fileNumber,
                 long blockOffset)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Writes this index structure to file, for in-memory indexes this will be to dump the content of the index into the file. For disk based indexes it will suffice to make sure that all data in the index is reflected on disk.

Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index should be stored.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

writeToFile

void writeToFile(BufferPool bufferPool,
                 int fileNumber,
                 long blockOffset,
                 int byteOffset)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Overload of the dumpToFile method with byte offset into the first block of the file.

Parameters:
bufferPool - The buffer pool managing the file.
fileNumber - The file number.
blockOffset - The block offset into the file where the index should be stored.
byteOffset - The number of bytes into the first block of the file the index starts.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On IO related errors.
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread is interupted.

getOnDiskSize

Pair<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer> getOnDiskSize()
Gets the on disk size of the index. May be used to place multiple indices in the same file etc.

Returns:
A pair of the block and byte size of the entry, null if no good estimate exists.
